tit.cmt: 「新思潮」そのものは特別な単語ではなく、そのままでは「新しい思潮」全般を含んでしまう気がします。「The」を加え特定の名称である旨示したほうが良いように思います。以下全てに同じ。

sen.j: 新思潮（しんしちょう）は、日本の文芸雑誌である。
sen.e: Shinshicho (New Tides of Thought) is a Japanese literary magazine.
The Shinshicho (New Tides of Thought) is a Japanese literary magazine.
The Shinshicho (New Tides of Thought) is a Japanese literary magazine.

sen.j: 1907年（明治40年）小山内薫が創刊し、東京大学（東京大学）系の同人誌として後に続いた。
sen.e: It was launched in 1907 by Kaoru OSANAI, and has survived as a dojinshi (hobby magazine) at the University of Tokyo.
sen.cmt: 原文「東京大学(東京大学)」とありますが、重複になるため訳文では()内を削りました。(以下同じ)。
sen.e: It was launched in 1907 by Kaoru OSANAI, and the publication has been carried on as a dojinshi (hobby magazine) at the University of Tokyo.
sen.cmt: 訳文で「has survived」とありますが、原文の「〜として後に続いた」をかなり意訳し、別の意味が付加されてしまうと思いますので、原文の意味に近いものに直しました。
sen.e: It was launched in 1907 by Kaoru OSANAI, and the publication has been carried on as a dojinshi (hobby magazine) at the University of Tokyo.

sen.j: 特に第3次-第4次新思潮の同人菊池寛、芥川龍之介、久米正雄、松岡讓らを新思潮派といい、大正文学の一つの拠点になった。
sen.e: In particular, the contributors to the third and fourth runs of Shinshicho such as Kan KIKUCHI, Ryunosuke AKUTAGAWA, Masao KUME and Yuzuru MATSUOKA were called the Shinshicho School, and became one of the bases for literature in the Taisho period.

In particular, the contributors to the third and fourth runs of Shinshicho such as Kan KIKUCHI, Ryunosuke AKUTAGAWA, Masao KUME and Yuzuru MATSUOKA were called the Shinshicho School, and became one of the bases for literature in the Taisho period.

In particular, the contributors to the third and fourth runs of Shinshicho such as Kan KIKUCHI, Ryunosuke AKUTAGAWA, Masao KUME and Yuzuru MATSUOKA were called the Shinshicho School, and became one of the bases for literature in the Taisho period.

sen.j: 沿革
sen.e: History
History
History
The first Shinshicho (1907-1908)
The first series of the Shinshicho (1907-1908)
sen.cmt: 数度にわたりシリーズが刊行されており、その第一シリーズという意味を加えています。
sen.e: The first series of the Shinshicho (1907-1908)

sen.j: 小山内の編集により総合的な文芸雑誌として創刊。
sen.e: It was launched under the editorship of Osanai as a general literary magazine.
It was launched under the editorship of OSANAI as a general literary magazine.
It was launched under the editorship of OSANAI as a general literary magazine.

sen.j: 資金は小山内の知人の援助による。
sen.e: For funding it relied on assistance from acquaintances of Osanai.
For funding its publication, OSANAI received assistance from his acquaintances.
sen.cmt: 訳文では「援助」より強い「援助を乞うた」の意味になっていますので、「援助を受けた」に変更しています。資金に関し、「出版のための」を加えています。「Osanai」を「OSANAI」に変更しました。
sen.e: For funding its publication, OSANAI received assistance from his acquaintances.

sen.j: アントン・チェーホフの翻訳やイプセン研究会の記録（藤村、花袋らが参加）などを掲載。
sen.e: It contained such articles as translations of Anton Chekhov and the proceedings of the Ibsen study group (joined by people like Toson and Katai).
It contained articles such as translations of Anton CHEKHOV and the proceedings of the IBSEN study group (group participants included Toson, Katai and others).
sen.cmt: 訳文「such articles as-」を「articles such as-」に変更しました。ChekhovとIbsenをCHEKHOVとIBSENに変更しました。括弧内の説明があまり適切ではないため赤字に変更しました。
sen.e: It contained articles such as translations of Anton CHEKHOV and the proceedings of the IBSEN study group (group participants included Toson, Katai and others).

sen.j: 6号まで刊行。
sen.e: It continued until the sixth issue.
The publication continued until the sixth issue.
sen.cmt: 原文では「刊行」とあります。「刊行」の意味を加えました。
sen.e: The publication continued until the sixth issue.
The second Shinshicho (1910-1911)
The second series of the Shinshicho (1910-1911)
sen.cmt: 第二シリーズという意味を加えています。
sen.e: The second series of the Shinshicho (1910-1911)

sen.j: 谷崎潤一郎、和辻哲郎、芦田均、木村荘太、後藤末雄、大貫晶川らが参加。
sen.e: The participants included: Junichiro TANIZAKI, Tetsuro WATSUJI, Hitoshi ASHIDA, Sota KIMURA, Sueo GOTO and Shosen ONUKI.
The participants included: Junichiro TANIZAKI, Tetsuro WATSUJI, Hitoshi ASHIDA, Sota KIMURA, Sueo GOTO and Shosen ONUKI.
The participants included: Junichiro TANIZAKI, Tetsuro WATSUJI, Hitoshi ASHIDA, Sota KIMURA, Sueo GOTO and Shosen ONUKI.

sen.j: 谷崎はデビュー作「誕生」や出世作「刺青」などを発表。
sen.e: Tanizaki published there such literary works as the drama 'Tanjo' (literally, 'The Birth'), his debut work, and the novel 'Shisei' (Tattooer), which made his name well known.
TANIZAKI published his debut drama piece 'Tanjo' (literally, 'The Birth'), and the work brought him recognition in the liberary circle, the novel 'Shisei' (Tattooer).
sen.cmt: 「Tanizaki」を「TANIZAIKI」に変更しました。訳文は多少ぎこちないため訳変更しています。
sen.e: TANIZAKI published his debut drama piece 'Tanjo' (literally, 'The Birth'), and the work brought him recognition in the liberary circle, the novel 'Shisei' (Tattooer).

sen.j: 小山内が創刊号に小説を寄稿。
sen.e: Osanai contributed a novel to its initial issue.
OSANAI contributed a novel to its initial issue.
OSANAI contributed a novel to its initial issue.

sen.j: 実態は東大の学生だった谷崎らの同人誌で、有名な『新思潮』の名を借りたようなもの。
sen.e: In reality, this was more like a dojinshi organized by Tanizaki and other contributors who were students of the University of Tokyo that had borrowed the name of the renowned "Shinshicho".

In reality, this second series was more of a dojinshi organized by TANIZAKI and other contributors who were still students at the University of Tokyo, which borrowed the renowned name of the "Shinshicho".
sen.cmt: 本項目を通じて、指示代名詞「it」「this」などが多く用いられ、その指示しているものが曖昧になりがちに思います。前項目からきちんと引き継ぎ必要な場合には代名詞でなく表記すべきと思います。「Tanizaki」を「TANIZAIKI」に変更しました。
sen.e: In reality, this second series was more of a dojinshi organized by TANIZAKI and other contributors who were still students at the University of Tokyo, which borrowed the renowned name of the "Shinshicho".

sen.j: 芦田によるアナトール・フランスの短篇小説の翻訳が原因で発売禁止処分を受け、終焉を迎える。
sen.e: Ashida's translation of a short story written by Anatole France resulted in the magazine's being barred from circulation and coming to an end.
This series of the magazine was banned because of a short story of Anatole France translated by ASHIDA, resulted in the end of publication.
sen.cmt: 「雑誌が発禁処分を受け終わった」が文の主旨ですので、文の順序を入れ替えました。その他、名前の大文字化、細かい言い回しの変更など行ないました。
sen.e: This series of the magazine was banned because of a short story of Anatole France translated by ASHIDA, resulted in the end of publication.
The third Shinshicho (1914)
The third series of the Shinshicho (1914)
sen.cmt: 既出項目と同様「series of the」を加えました。
sen.e: The third series of the Shinshicho (1914)

sen.j: 久米正雄、松岡譲、豊島与志雄、山本有三らが活躍。
sen.e: People such as Masao KUME, Yuzuru MATSUOKA, Yoshio TOYOSHIMA and Yuzo YAMAMOTO took a lively part.
Contributors such as Masao KUME, Yuzuru MATSUOKA, Yoshio TOYOSHIMA and Yuzo YAMAMOTO took a lively role in the magazine.
sen.cmt: Peopleはあまりにも一般的すぎますので、訳者が用いた「contributors」としています。
sen.e: Contributors such as Masao KUME, Yuzuru MATSUOKA, Yoshio TOYOSHIMA and Yuzo YAMAMOTO took a lively role in the magazine.

sen.j: 小山内が創刊号に評論を寄稿。
sen.e: Osanai contributed a critical essay to its initial issue.
Osanai contributed a literal criticism piece to the initial issue of this series of the magazine.
sen.cmt: 「Osanai」を「OSANAI」に変更しています。なお「critical essay」は間違いではないですが、通常は別の意味、「重大な、重要な」などの意味で使われることが多いですので「criticism」としました。その他、同様に説明不足と思われる内容を加えました。
sen.e: Osanai contributed a literal criticism piece to the initial issue of this series of the magazine.

sen.j: 芥川龍之介（筆名：柳川隆之助）も翻訳などで参加、近衛文麿や井川恭（恒藤恭）もアイルランド出身作家の作品を翻訳。
sen.e: Ryunosuke AKUTAGAWA (under the pseudonym Ryunosuke YANAGAWA) also took part in it with translations of literary works, and Fumimaro KONOE and Kyo IGAWA (Kyo TSUNETO) translated the works of some Irish writers into Japanese.

Ryunosuke AKUTAGAWA (under the pseudonym Ryunosuke YANAGAWA) also took part in the publication by translating literary works, while Fumimaro KONOE and Kyo IGAWA (Kyo TSUNETO) translated the works of some Irish writers.
sen.cmt: 上述のように「it」等はできるだけ避け、再記述すべきと思います。
sen.e: Ryunosuke AKUTAGAWA (under the pseudonym Ryunosuke YANAGAWA) also took part in the publication by translating literary works, while Fumimaro KONOE and Kyo IGAWA (Kyo TSUNETO) translated the works of some Irish writers.
The fourth Shinshicho (1916-1917)
The fourth series of the Shinshicho (1916-1917)
sen.cmt: 既出項目と同様「series of the」を加えました。
sen.e: The fourth series of the Shinshicho (1916-1917)

sen.j: 成瀬正一 (フランス文学者)、久米正雄、菊池寛、芥川龍之介らが参加。
sen.e: Shoichi NARUSE (a scholar of French literature), Masao KUME, Kan KIKUCHI and Ryunosuke AKUTAGAWA participated in it.
Shoichi NARUSE (a scholar of French literature), Masao KUME, Kan KIKUCHI and Ryunosuke AKUTAGAWA participated in the publication of this series.
sen.cmt: 上述のように「it」等はできるだけ避け、再記述すべきと思います。
sen.e: Shoichi NARUSE (a scholar of French literature), Masao KUME, Kan KIKUCHI and Ryunosuke AKUTAGAWA participated in the publication of this series.

sen.j: 創刊号に掲載された芥川の「鼻 (芥川龍之介)」が夏目漱石に激賞された。
sen.e: Akutagawa's 'Hana' (The Nose), which was contained in the initial issue, was acclaimed by Soseki NATSUME.
sen.cmt: 原文「鼻(芥川龍之介)」とありますが、文脈より芥川の作だと明らかなため、訳出では()内は削りました。(以下同じ)
sen.e: A work of Akutagawa, 'Hana' (The Nose) contained in the initial issue, was highly acclaimed by Soseki NATSUME.
sen.cmt: 訳文で「was」が続き不自然なため、省略した形に変更しました。
sen.e: A work of Akutagawa, 'Hana' (The Nose) contained in the initial issue, was highly acclaimed by Soseki NATSUME.
The fifth Shinshicho (1918-1919)
The fifth sereis of the Shinshicho (1918-1919)
sen.cmt: 既出項目と同様「series of the」を加えました。
sen.e: The fifth sereis of the Shinshicho (1918-1919)

sen.j: 里見弴の弟子の中戸川吉二らが参加。
sen.e: It included participants such as Kichiji NAKATOGAWA, Ton SATOMI's disciple.
It included participants such as Kichiji NAKATOGAWA, Ton SATOMI's disciple.
It included participants such as Kichiji NAKATOGAWA, Ton SATOMI's disciple.
The sixth Shinshicho (1921-)
The sixth series of the Shinshicho (1921-)
sen.cmt: 既出項目と同様「series of the」を加えました。
sen.e: The sixth series of the Shinshicho (1921-)

sen.j: 川端康成、今東光、鈴木彦次郎、石浜金作、酒井真人らが参加。
sen.e: The participants were people such as Yasunari KAWABATA, Toko KON, Hikojiro SUZUKI, Kinsaku ISHIHAMA and Mahito SAKAI.
The participants included Yasunari KAWABATA, Toko KON, Hikojiro SUZUKI, Kinsaku ISHIHAMA and Mahito SAKAI.
sen.cmt: 不要と思われる部分を削除、文章を短縮しました。
sen.e: The participants included Yasunari KAWABATA, Toko KON, Hikojiro SUZUKI, Kinsaku ISHIHAMA and Mahito SAKAI.
The seventh Shinshicho (1924)
The seventh series of the Shinshicho (1924)
sen.cmt: 既出項目と同様「series of the」を加えました。
sen.e: The seventh series of the Shinshicho (1924)
The eighth Shinshicho (1927-1928)
The eighth series of the Shinshicho (1927-1928)
sen.cmt: 既出項目と同様「series of the」を加えました。
sen.e: The eighth series of the Shinshicho (1927-1928)
The ninth Shinshicho (1925-1929) ?
The ninth series of the Shinshicho (1925-1929) ?
sen.cmt: 既出項目と同様「series of the」を加えました。
sen.e: The ninth series of the Shinshicho (1925-1929) ?
The tenth Shinshicho (1929-1930)
The tenth series of the Shinshicho (1929-1930)
sen.cmt: 既出項目と同様「series of the」を加えました。
sen.e: The tenth series of the Shinshicho (1929-1930)
The eleventh Shinshicho (1932-)
The eleventh series of the Shinshicho (1932-)
sen.cmt: 既出項目と同様「series of the」を加えました。
sen.e: The eleventh series of the Shinshicho (1932-)
The twelfth Shinshicho (1934-)
The twelfth series of the Shinshicho (1934-)
sen.cmt: 既出項目と同様「series of the」を加えました。
sen.e: The twelfth series of the Shinshicho (1934-)

sen.j: 第13次
sen.e: The thirteenth Shinshicho
The thirteenth series of the Shinshicho
sen.cmt: 既出項目と同様「series of the」を加えました。この項目には年号が含まれていません。
sen.e: The thirteenth series of the Shinshicho
The fourteenth Shinshicho (1947-1948)
The fourteenth series of the Shinshicho (1947-1948)
sen.cmt: 既出項目と同様「series of the」を加えました。
sen.e: The fourteenth series of the Shinshicho (1947-1948)

sen.j: 中井英夫、吉行淳之介ら
sen.e: Hideo NAKAI, Jyunnosuke YOSHIYUKI and others
The participants included Hideo NAKAI, Jyunnosuke YOSHIYUKI and others.
sen.cmt: 既出項目同様とするため赤字を加え文章としました。
sen.e: The participants included Hideo NAKAI, Jyunnosuke YOSHIYUKI and others.
The fifteenth Shinshicho (1950-1958)
The fifteenth series of the Shinshicho (1950-1958)
sen.cmt: 既出項目と同様「series of the」を加えました。
sen.e: The fifteenth series of the Shinshicho (1950-1958)

sen.j: 阿川弘之、奥野健男、曽野綾子、三浦朱門、村上兵衛、阪田寛夫、梶山季之、有吉佐和子らが参加。
sen.e: People such as Hiroyuki AGAWA, Takeo OKUNO, Ayako SONO, Shumon MIURA, Hyoe MURAKAMI, Hiroo SAKATA, Toshiyuki KAJIYAMA and Sawako ARIYOSHI took part in it.
sen.cmt: 「阪田寛夫」の「ひろお」は長音ではないため、Hirooと表記しました。
sen.e: Contributors such as Hiroyuki AGAWA, Takeo OKUNO, Ayako SONO, Shumon MIURA, Hyoe MURAKAMI, Hiroo SAKATA, Toshiyuki KAJIYAMA and Sawako ARIYOSHI took part in the publication of this series.
sen.cmt: 既出項目同様「People」を「contributors」としました。「it」内容を記述しました。
sen.e: Contributors such as Hiroyuki AGAWA, Takeo OKUNO, Ayako SONO, Shumon MIURA, Hyoe MURAKAMI, Hiroo SAKATA, Toshiyuki KAJIYAMA and Sawako ARIYOSHI took part in the publication of this series.

sen.j: 雑誌『新潮』で、同人誌推薦作としての作品掲載もあった。
sen.e: The magazine "Shincho" even published some works as "special recommendations" from this dojinshi.
The magazine "Shincho" even published some works as "special recommendations" from this dojinshi.
The magazine "Shincho" even published some works as "special recommendations" from this dojinshi.

sen.j: また1957年に芥川賞推薦の一票を得た。
sen.e: In addition, a work in the magazine was recommended for the Akutagawa Prize in 1957.
sen.cmt: 1957年の芥川賞の受賞作・最終候補一覧には「新思潮」からのものはなかったのですが、芥川賞の選考過程からすると、最終候補に残る前の候補作にあった可能性があります。そのため、訳出ではそのように訳しました。
sen.e: In addition, a work in the magazine was recommended for the Akutagawa Prize in 1957.
In addition, a work in the magazine was recommended for the Akutagawa Prize in 1957.
The sixteenth Shinshicho (1961-1964)
The sixteenth series of the Shinshicho (1961-1964)
sen.cmt: 既出項目と同様「series of the」を加えました。
sen.e: The sixteenth series of the Shinshicho (1961-1964)
The seventeenth Shinshicho (1964-1967)
The seventeenth series of the Shinshicho (1964-1967)
sen.cmt: 既出項目と同様「series of the」を加えました。
sen.e: The seventeenth series of the Shinshicho (1964-1967)

The eighteenth series of the Shinshicho (1969-1970)
sen.cmt: 既出項目と同様「series of the」を加えました。

The nineteenth series of the Shinshicho (1976-1979)
